intro: Malidra, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and small, violet-colored flowers. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Malidra thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils.
